}}  'Edson Arantes do
Nascimento' (), better known as 'PelÃ©' (, name given as Edison on birth
certificate, born 21 October 1940 â however, PelÃ© himself claims that he was
born on 23 October Official forename and birth
date, as written on his birth certificate, are "Edison" and "21 October 1940":
{{quotation|CERTIDÃO DE NASCIMENTO  CERTIFICO que sob o nÂ° 7.095 Ã s fls.
123 do livro nÂ° 21-A de Registro de Nascimento consta o assento de Edison
Arantes do Nascimento nascido aos vinte e um (21) outubro de mil novecentos e
quarenta (1940) Ã s 03 horas e --- minutos em esta Cidade de TrÃªs CoraÃ§Ãµes sexo
masculino filho de JoÃ£o Ramos do Nascimento e de Celeste Arantes }} However,
PelÃ© has always maintained that those are mistakes, that he was actually named
Edson and that he was born on 23 October 1940.

{{cite book |title=PelÃ© : the autobiography |author=PelÃ© |coauthors=Orlando
Duarte, Alex Bellos |year=2006 |publisher=Simon & Schuster UK Ltd
|location=London |isbn=978-0-7432-7582-8 |page=14 |url=http://books.simonandschuster.com.au/Pele-The-
Autobiography/Pele/9781416511212/excerpt_with_id/6070 |accessdate=2 October 2010
|quote=Shortly before I came along, there was another arrival in TrÃªs CoraÃ§Ãµes:
electricity. In order to celebrate this great improvement to our daily lives,
Dondinho named me Edson, a tribute to Thomas Edison, the inventor of the
lightbulb. In fact, on my birth certificate I am actually called Edison with an
'i', a mistake that persists to this day. I'm Edson with no 'i', but to my
eternal annoyance quite often the 'i' appears on official or personal documents
and time after time I have to explain why. As if that wasn't confusing enough,
they got the date wrong on my birth certificate as well â it says 21 October.
I'm not sure how this came about; probably because in Brazil we're not so fussy
about accuracy. This is another mistake that carries on to this day. When I took
out my first passport, the date was put in as 21 October and each time I have
renewed it the date has stayed the same. }} ), is
a retired Brazilian footballer. He is regarded by many experts, football
critics, former players, current players and football fans in general as the
best player of all
time. [http://www.fifa.com/newscentre/features/news/newsid=1656982 Pele: The
greatest of them all] FIFA.com [http://www.fussball-geschichte.com/besten-
spieler.htm (in german)] [http://www.fifa.com/worldfootbal-
l/news/newsid=1321917.html#what+they+said+about+pele "What they said about
Pele"]. FIFA.com. [http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/international/pele-the-
perfect-player-743002.html -Bobby Moore: "Pele was the most complete player I've
ever seen, he had everything. Two good feet. Magic in the air. Quick. Powerful.
Could beat people with skill. Could outrun people. Only 5 ft 8 in
tall, yet he seemed a giant of an athlete on the pitch. Perfect balance and
impossible vision. He was the greatest because he could do anything and
everything on a football pitch. I remember Saldhana the coach being asked by a
Brazilian journalist who was the best goalkeeper in his squad. He said Pele. The
man could play in any position."] Independent.co.uk [http://www.fifa.com/wo-
rldfootball/news/newsid=1321917.html#what+they+said+about+pele -Ferenc Puskas:
âThe greatest player in history was Di Stefano. I refuse to classify Pele as a
player. He was above that."] FIFA.com
[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/4518960.stm -JosÃ© Mourinho: "I
think he is football. You have the real special one - Mr Pele."] BBC Sport [http://www.newstatesman.com/uk-politics/2009/03/football-politics-team-
tony-2 -Sir Alex Ferguson: "Question:-Best player you ever saw? -AF: PelÃ©, di
Stefano, Maradona, Cruyff. -Q:In that order? -AF: Yes, I think so."]
Newstatesman.com [http://www.mtnfootball.com/europe/la-liga/news/2011/oct/19-romario-messi-
could-learn-from-pele.html -Romario: "Messi has all the conditions to be the
best, but first he has to beat Maradona, Romario and then eventually Pele."]
Mtnfootball.com [http://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/news/newsid=1321917.html-
#what+they+said+about+pele -Costa Pereira: âI arrived hoping to stop a great
man, but I went away convinced I had been undone by someone who was not born on
the same planet as the rest of us."] FIFA.com
[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WhBflqCxj6Q -Michel Platini: "There's Pele
the man, and then Pele the player. And to play like Pele is to play like God."]
[http://blogs.bettor.com/Scolari-rates-Pele-over-Lionel-Messi-a201445 -Luiz
Felipe Scolari: âMessi is one of the three best in the world. He's living a
great moment. But for me Pele remains the best and will be for years.â]
[http://www.lacancha.com/eusebio.htm -Eusebio: "Pele played in an era which
had so many great players and in that atmosphere he stood out above the others.
He was the complete player in every aspect as well as being a kind human being.
Cristiano Ronaldo is young yet, and has many years ahead of himself. But as of
now, I do not see anyone who can compare with Pele"] Lacancha.com [http://w-
ww.fifa.com/worldfootball/news/newsid=1321917.html#what+they+said+about+pele -
Johan Cruyff: "Pele was the only footballer who surpassed the boundaries of
logic."] FIFA.com [http://www.goal.com/en/news/12/spain/2012/09/10/3366174/pele-was-better-
than-messi-cristiano-ronaldo-says-di-stefano -Alfredo Di Stefano: "The best
player ever? Pele. Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo are both great players with
specific qualities, but Pele was better."] Goal.com goal.com [http://www.fi-
fa.com/worldfootball/news/newsid=1321917.html#what+they+said+about+pele -Sir
Bobby Charlton: âI sometimes feel as though football was invented for this
magical player."] FIFA.com [http://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/news/newsid=1-
321917.html#what+they+said+about+pele -Tostao: "Pele was the greatest â he was
simply flawless. And off the pitch he is always smiling and upbeat. You never
see him bad-tempered. He loves being Pele."]
[http://www.fifa.com/classicfootball/players/player=63869/quotes.html -Zico:
"This debate about the player of the century is absurd. There's only one
possible answer: Pele. He's the greatest player of all time, and by some
distance I might add."]
[http://www.fifa.com/classicfootball/players/player=63869/quotes.html -Franz
Beckenbauer: "Pele is the greatest player of all time. He reigned supreme for 20
years. All the others - Diego Maradona, Johan Cruyff, Michel Platini - rank
beneath him. There's no one to compare with Pele."] -
[http://www.fifa.com/classicfootball/players/player=63869/quotes.html -
Tarcisio Burgnich: "Before the match, I told myself that Pele was just flesh and
bones like the rest of us. Later I realised I'd been wrong."] [http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2931/go-global/2012/01/11/2841564/cesar-
luis-menotti-neymar-must-decide-whether-he-wants-to-be -Cesar Luis Menotti: "The
best of all was Pele, who is a mixture of Di Stefano, Maradona, Cruyff and Leo
Messi."] Goal.com [http://www.elgrancampeon.com.ar/index.php?option=com_con-
tent&view=article&id=9392%3Amenotti-qpele-fue-el-mas-grande-
&catid=24%3Adt&Itemid=28 -Cesar Luis Menotti: "It's ugly to compare but the
greatest was Pele. If we believe that God made man, the "black" PelÃ© he made him
perfect. He gave him everything. He lacked nothing, header, physical power,
dribbling, finishing, inspiration, genius, temper, vision, goal. Everything."]
[http://www.soccerway.com/news/2012/March/27/rivera-pele-better-than-messi/
-Gianni Rivera: "However, I do think there's someone who was even better(than
Messi) and that's Pele. He used both feet on the pitch. He was as dangerous with
his right as he was with his left. He was strong in the air as well, and created
a lot of chances."] Soccerway.com
[http://www.diariomundonuevo.com/diario/noticias.php?var1=6569 -Hugo Gatti:
"PelÃ© had the skin of a player, head, pace, everything. He was a panther dressed
in white, I played with him. He entered to play in the last minute and he could
turn the match. And the big difference is that PelÃ© on the field created fear,
Maradona not...For me, it is PelÃ©, Alfredo Di Stefano and Maradona, in that
order. I appreciate Diego, he is a great player. But from another planet was
PelÃ©, not him."] Diariomundonuevo.com [http://depor.pe/noticia/450571/cubillas-pele-mejor-todos-
tiempos -TeÃ³filo Cubillas: "I confronted him several times on the pitch and I
think there will be noone like him."] [http://www.goal.com/en/news/584/brazil/2010/10/23/2175024/exclusive-peles-
former-teammate-zito-hails-neymar-as-his -Zito: "Maradona was a great forward
and a great player, but he is not Pele. I can't compare him to Pele..."]
Goal.com [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vA_qNRY59XY -Mario Zagallo: "Pele
represented everything in soccer because of what he has done on the pitch."] [http://www.goal.com/en/news/60/south-america/2010/10/21/2176031/70-facts-
about-brazil-legend-football-icon-pele-on-his-70th -Cristiano Ronaldo: "Pele is
the greatest player in football history, and there would only be one Pele in the
world."] Goal.com [http://www.goal.com/en/news/60/south-america/2010/10/21/2176031/70-facts-
about-brazil-legend-football-icon-pele-on-his-70th -Geoffrey Green: "Di Stefano
was manufactured on earth, Pele was made in heaven."] Goal.com http://www.goal.com/en/news/12/spain/2012/09/10/3366174/pele-was-
better-than-messi-cristiano-ronaldo-says-di-stefano [http://-
newsvote.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/world_cup_2006/5051768.stm Pele tops World
Cup legends poll] BBC News. Retrieved 12 June 2010 http://www.goal.co-
m/en/news/585/argentina/2012/03/25/2991317/tostao-messi-better-than-maradona-
but-not-pele [http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2931/go-
global/2010/10/22/2178640/over-50-per-cent-of-goalcom-uk-readers-believe-
brazilian Over 50 per cent of Goal.com UK readers believe Brazilian legend Pele
was a greater player than Diego Maradona] Goal.com. Retrieved 1 May
2011 [http://www.englandfootballonline.com/TeamHons/HonsWldSocPlyrsCent.html
World Soccer Players of the Century] England Football Online Retrieved 1 May 2011 [http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1190865/THE-LIST-
The-greatest-players-history-football-Nos-10-1.html THE LIST: The greatest
players in the history of football] Daily Mail. Retrieved 1 May
2011 In 1999, he was voted Football Player of the
Century by the International Federation of Football History & Statistics
(IFFHS). In the same year French weekly magazine [[France Football]]
consulted their former Ballon D'Or winners to elect the Football Player of the
Century. PelÃ© came in first place. [http://www.rsssf.com/miscellaneous/best-x-players-of-
y.html#ff-poc France Football's Football Player of the Century] Retrieved 1 May
2011 PelÃ© was elected "Athlete of the Century" by the International
Olympic Committee and Reuters News Agency in 1999, and by French newspaper
L'Ãquipe in 1981. During his playing days
PelÃ© was for a period the best paid athlete in the world. http:/-
/news.google.com/newspapers?id=U5scAAAAIBAJ&sjid=B2YEAAAAIBAJ&pg=3185,795141&dq-
=wilt+chamberlain&hl=en According to the International
Federation of Football History & Statistics (IFFHS) he is the most successful
league goal scorer in the world, with 541 league goals. In total PelÃ© scored 1281 goals in 1363
games. [http://www.fifa.com/classicfootball/players/player=63869/index.html
PELÃ: The King of Football ] FIFA.com. Retrieved 1 May 2011 In his native Brazil, PelÃ© is hailed as a national hero. Harris, Harry (2002), PelÃ©: his life and times. p.190.
Welcome Rain Publishers. Retrieved 27 June 2011 He is known for his
accomplishments and contributions to the game of football. He is also
acknowledged for his vocal support of policies to improve the social conditions
of the poor (when he scored his 1,000th goal he dedicated it to the poor
children of Brazil). During his career, he became known as "The Black
Pearl" (PÃ©rola Negra), "The King of Football" (O Rei do Futebol), "The King
PelÃ©" (O Rei PelÃ©) or simply "The King" (O
Rei). http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0671446/bio Various from many of his biographies, See for example [http://pele.m-qp-
m.com/english/pele.shtml] 3rd section, last line: " 'The King' was given to PelÃ©
by the French press in 1961 after he played a few matches with SFC in Europe" Or
the already quote [http://espn.go.com/classic/biography/s/Pele.html] Or the book
"Pele, King of Soccer/Pele, El rey del futbol â Monica Brown (Author) & Rudy
Gutierrez (Illustrator) Rayo Publishing Dec.2008 ISBN 978-0-06-122779-0
"

He was trained since birth to become great by his father, mentor and former
footballer (who was the top scorer in every season he played for, for every
team) Dondinho. Later spotted, at Bauru AtlÃ©tico Clube, by football star
Waldemar de Brito, PelÃ© began playing for Santos at 15
and his national team at 16, and won his first World Cup at 17. Despite numerous
offers from European clubs, he could not leave Brazil because of a law keeping
him there. In 1961 President JÃ¢nio Quadros had PelÃ© declared a national
treasure, thus enabling
Santos to keep PelÃ© for almost two decades until 1974. With PelÃ© within their
ranks, Santos reached their zenith by winning the 1962 and 1963 Copa
Libertadores, the most prestigious club competition in South American
football.  In
1962 Santos became the first football club ever to win four out of four
competitions in a single year, thus achieving the quadruple. Anibal Massaini Neto (Director/Producer), (2004). PelÃ© Eterno
[Documentary film]. Brazil: Anima ProduÃ§Ãµes Audiovisuais Ltda. International:
Universal Studios Home Video. PelÃ©âs electrifying
play and penchant for spectacular goals made him a star around the world. His
team Santos toured internationally in order to take full advantage of his
popularity. PelÃ© played most of his career as a deep-
lying forward. PelÃ©'s technique and natural athleticism have been
universally praised and during his playing years he was renowned for his
excellent dribbling and passing, his pace, powerful shot, exceptional heading
ability, and prolific goalscoring.

He is the all-time leading scorer of the Brazil national football team and is
the only footballer to be a part of three World Cup-winning squads. [http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/worldcup2010/article-
1285718/Sportsmails-10-World-Cup-Gods-Our-look-best-best.html 10 World Cup Gods!
Our look at the best of the best in World Cup history] Mail Online. Retrieved 10
May 2011 In 1962, his second World Cup victory, he was on the Brazilian
squad at the start of the World Cup but because of an injury suffered in the
second match, he was not able to play the remainder of the tournament. In
November 2007, FIFA announced that he would be awarded the 1962 medal
retroactively, making him the only player in the world to have three World Cup
winning medals.

Since his retirement in 1977, PelÃ© has been a worldwide ambassador for football
and has undertaken various acting roles and commercial ventures. He is currently
the Honorary President of the New York Cosmos.
